item.title: The mix (and mess) of Packet Filter in Linux Part 2 - eBPF + XDP
item.description: Introduction In the first part of this article, I’ve shown the most common (so far) methods of doing packet filtering in Linux. This part of the article is all dedicated to cover a brief introduction of eBPF and XDP, being used to packet filtering. I’ll not cover the usage of eBPF to monitor resources and performance, but there’s plenty of materials available and I’ll put some at the end of this article.
